title: Neubaufahrzeug
description: Germany’s multi-turreted heavy tank prototype developed in the early 1930s.
history: The Neubaufahrzeug (NbFz) was an experimental German heavy tank designed in the early 1930s as part of Germany’s initial rearmament program. Intended to explore multi-turret layouts and heavy armament for breakthrough operations, the vehicle served primarily as a testbed for automotive and weapons concepts rather than a production combat system. Only a handful of vehicles were built, and they saw limited action for propaganda and training purposes.

variants.name: Neubaufahrzeug (Krupp)
variants.description: Prototype constructed by Krupp featuring a multi-turreted layout with a 75 mm main gun.

variants.name: Neubaufahrzeug (Rheinmetall)
variants.description: Prototype built by Rheinmetall, similar layout with minor design differences.

related.name: Pz.Kpfw. IV
related.description: Later German medium tank that benefited from lessons learned on the Neubaufahrzeug program.
